transportAdvice: Vilnius has a well-developed public bus and trolleybus network that covers most tourist areas, and the compact Old Town is very walkable. Taxis and ride-hailing services are widely available throughout the city for longer journeys or late-night travel.

weather.description: Cold, grey winter month with frequent snow and frost; pack warm layers and waterproof footwear.
Still firmly winter with lingering snow and icy conditions; one of the coldest months of the year.
Early signs of spring emerge but temperatures remain chilly and snow is still possible.
Mild and increasingly pleasant with blooming trees, though cool evenings require a jacket.
Warm and green with longer days; one of the most enjoyable months to visit Vilnius.
Warm summer weather with long daylight hours and occasional afternoon showers.
The warmest month of the year with comfortable temperatures and lively outdoor activity.
Still warm and summery with occasional thunderstorms; a popular time for festivals and events.
Early autumn brings cooler air and golden foliage; pleasant for sightseeing with fewer crowds.
Noticeably cooler and wetter with frequent overcast skies; a warm coat becomes essential.
Cold and damp with the first frosts possible; daylight hours are short and conditions are grey.
Cold winter month with snow likely and festive Christmas markets adding charm to the Old Town.
